title: How much vacuum is in a condenser? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends on type, size and economy of the plant. In power plants, the more vacuum, the better because of lower cold temperature and more efficiency, but this implies also more pumping, cooling, seals, de-aeration, etc. which can lead to increased capex and opex. A normal value for a power plant, water-cooled, large size, is around 0.05–0.06 bar, or 50-60 mbar absolute
